result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

8:08 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF58, 22CF134, 22CF264, & 22CF370. ADA Ellenwood recites joint recommendation.  Atty Davis agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Bail Jumping-Felony in 22CF264 and G to Ct 1- Bail Jumping Felony in 22CF370.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF264 & Ct 1 in 22CF370.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF264 and Ct 2-5 in 22CF370, Court also dismisses 22CF58 & 22CF134.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF264

S/W 2 Years Probation  Concurrent with current probation

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Surcharge: $250
 Apply Bond to Atty Fees. If remaining money, apply to costs/surcharge, balance to be paid through probation

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF370

S/W 2 Years Probation  Concurrent with current probation

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Surcharge: $250
 Apply Bond to Atty Fees. If remaining money, apply to costs/surcharge, balance to be paid through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- AODA and follow through 
- Absolute sobriety
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Follow through with any assessments and programming 

Court reserves on credit, attorneys to calculate credit by Wednesday, 11/2/22

Court advises DE to set up payment plan with JSC commencing in December at $50 per month. bph

11:21 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius, DF: Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann appeared. INCLUDES 20CF323 (SEH), 21CF525 (SEH), 22CF58 (STC), 22CF134 (STC), 22CF264 (STC) and 22CF370 (STC). 22CF370: QUASH WARRANT. 20CF323 and 21CF525: Court reads charge and maximum penalty. PSI completed by Agent Volz. Counsel has no corrections to PSI. Sentencing arguments. 

Court orders: 
20CF323
Ct 1 - OWI 4th
S/W 4 years probation with conditions:
- 8 months conditional jail time - Huber authorized for employment and seek work
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Testing random and regulary
- Complete Domestic Violence assessment and follow through with recommendations
- No contact with Catherine G., except for child custody exchanges and child care and comply with child protection order
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting
- Participate in Moral Reconation Therapy
- 3 years driver's license revocation
- 3 years IID
- Complete Driver's Safety Plan
- Fine $1,744; inclusive of costs and surcharge

21CF525

Pretrial Bond Report. Includes 20CF323, 21CF525, 22CF58, 22CF134, 22CF264. Filed by JSC Kelli. S. arc    to kp
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km         to js
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km       to js
Supplemental Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC.  gll   to js 5/20
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

- **AMENDED**

- Includes 20CF323, 21CF525, and 22CF264 

- Bond on File. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 3 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

- I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center, upon release, located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Catherine L. Garcia.  EXCEPT contact authorized through a 3rd party regarding child exchange.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Preliminary hearing on April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:23  AM   Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann appeared. Agent Volz appeared.  INCLUDES:  22CF264, 20CF323, 21CF525,  Set for Bond Review hearing.  Court notes 22CF264 came in for INIT on 4/22 before TCH where bond was set, but reset for a continued INIT today. Court notes Agent Volz letter as well as pretrial violatons w/JSC. Atty Satorius makes statements. Atty Ellenwood notes no formal motion to withdraw plea, asks for plea to remain and not remand on 20CF323 bond. Court questions if DE still qualifies for PD on 22CF264. Atty Satorius responds. DE states he will not be withdrawing his plea, would like to keep Atty Satorius as counsel.  Atty Satorius makes statements hopeful to have resolution for 5/17 plea, to include 22CF264. Agent Volz is not sure she can complete PSI by plea date due to issues with interviewing DE. Court remands DE into the custody of the SCC jail, when Agent Volz completes interview with the DE, Court would consider release. Atty Satouis does not waive timelimits for PH on 22CF264.  Adjourned:  11:36 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
